info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 14 at 4:18AM EDT until June 14 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Harrison County in east central Ohio... Southwestern Jefferson County in east central Ohio... Northeastern Guernsey County in east central Ohio... Southern Carroll County in east central Ohio... Western Belmont County in east central Ohio... Southeastern Tuscarawas County in east central Ohio... Northeastern Noble County in east central Ohio... * Until 500 AM EDT. * At 417 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Waynesburg to 7 miles south of Newcomerstown, moving southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Uhrichsville, St. Clairsville, Barnesville, Cadiz, Carrollton, Freeport, Dennison, Bethesda, Antrim, Hopedale, Flushing, and Scio. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
